note: ## Reading List: Current Issues in NLG (2020 and Earlier

title: This list focuses on articles addressing the lack of diversity, non-factuality, and evaluation metrics in NLG, published up to
**Lack of Diversity:**
**"Towards a More Diverse and Inclusive NLP: A Call for Action"**
- This paper by the ACL Special Interest Group on NLP for Social Good highlights the need for diversity in NLP research and applications
- This paper by Caliskan et al. explores gender bias in word embeddings and its implications for NLG
- This survey paper by Blodgett et al
container-title: discusses various aspects of fairness and bias in NLP, including NLG

title: **"The Social Impact of Natural Language Processing"**
- This paper by Crawford discusses the social implications of NLP, including the need for diversity and inclusivity
**"Linguistic Diversity in Natural Language Processing: A Survey"**
- This survey paper by Li et al. explores the challenges and opportunities of incorporating linguistic diversity into NLP, including NLG
**Non-Factuality of Generated Text:**
**"Evaluating the Factuality of Text Generation Models"**
- This paper by Rashkin et al. proposes a new metric for evaluating the factuality of generated text
**"Towards Faithful and Informative Text Generation with Factual Verification"**
- This paper by Fan et al. presents a method for improving the factuality of generated text by incorporating factual verification
**"Learning to Generate Factual Summaries from Multiple Documents"**
- This paper by Nallapati et al. explores the use of multiple documents to improve the factuality of generated summaries
**"A Survey of Text Generation: From Deep Learning to Content Control"**
- This survey paper by Zhang et al. discusses various aspects of text generation, including the challenge of ensuring factuality
**"Generating Factual Summaries from Multiple Documents: A Deep Learning Approach"**
- This paper by Nallapati et al. proposes a deep learning approach for generating factual summaries from multiple documents
**"Beyond Accuracy: Evaluating NLP Models for Social Good"**
- This paper by Thorne et al. argues for the need to go beyond accuracy when evaluating NLP models, especially for social good applications
**"Evaluating Text Generation: A Survey"**
- This survey paper by Reimers et al. provides a comprehensive overview of evaluation metrics for text generation
**"Automatic Evaluation of Text Generation: A Survey"**
- This survey paper by Liu et al. discusses various automatic evaluation metrics for text generation
**"Human Evaluation of Text Generation: A Survey"**
- This survey paper by Reimers et al. explores the use of human evaluation in text generation
**"BLEU: a Method for Automatic Evaluation of Machine Translation"**
- This paper by Papineni et al. introduces the BLEU metric, a widely used metric for evaluating machine translation and text generation
**"The State of Natural Language Generation: Challenges and Opportunities"**
- This paper by Gatt et al. provides a comprehensive overview of the current state of NLG
**"Natural Language Generation: A Tutorial"**
- This tutorial by Gatt et al. provides an introduction to NLG for beginners
**"A Survey of Text Generation: From Deep Learning to Content Control"**
- This survey paper by Zhang et al. discusses various aspects of text generation, including the challenges of ensuring factuality and diversity
- This paper by Sutskever et al. discusses the use of neural networks for machine translation, which has had a significant impact on NLG
**"Deep Learning for Natural Language Processing"**
- This paper by Collobert et al. provides an overview of deep learning techniques for NLP, including NLG
This list provides a starting point for exploring the current issues in NLG. It is important to note that this is not an exhaustive list, and there are many other relevant articles available
Remember to consider the context and limitations of each article, and to critically evaluate the findings
